in germany, data privacy is considered a fundamental right and is highly respected by the government and citizens. the european union's general data protection regulation (gdpr) was implemented in may 2018 to give individuals more control over their personal information. companies must obtain explicit consent before collecting or processing any user data. penalties for violating gdpr include fines of up to â‚¬20 million or four percent of a company's annual global revenue, whichever is greater. it is essential that users are aware of the potential risks associated with sharing their personal information online and take appropriate measures to protect themselves.</s>
